name: stackit
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing stackit resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`stackit` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/stackitcloud/terraform-provider-stackit).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing stackit resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/stackitcloud/terraform-provider-stackit)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,

authorizationCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Membership service

cdnCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the CDN service

credentialsPath.description: Path of JSON from where the credentials are read. Takes precedence over the env var `STACKIT_CREDENTIALS_PATH`. Default value is `~/.stackit/credentials.json`.

defaultRegion.description: Region will be used as the default location for regional services. Not all services require a region, some are global

dnsCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the DNS service

edgecloudCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Edge Cloud service

enableBetaResources.description: Enable beta resources. Default is false.

experiments.description: Enables experiments. These are unstable features without official support. More information can be found in the README. Available Experiments: iam, routing-tables, network

gitCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Git service

iaasCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the IaaS service

kmsCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the KMS service

loadbalancerCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Load Balancer service

logmeCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the LogMe service

logsCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Logs service

mariadbCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the MariaDB service

modelservingCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the AI Model Serving service

mongodbflexCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the MongoDB Flex service

objectstorageCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Object Storage service

observabilityCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Observability service

oidcRequestToken.description: The bearer token for the request to the OIDC provider. For use when authenticating as a Service Account using OpenID Connect.

oidcRequestUrl.description: The URL for the OIDC provider from which to request an ID token. For use when authenticating as a Service Account using OpenID Connect.

opensearchCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the OpenSearch service

postgresflexCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the PostgresFlex service

privateKey.description: Private RSA key used for authentication, relevant for the key flow. It takes precedence over the private key that is included in the service account key.

privateKeyPath.description: Path for the private RSA key used for authentication, relevant for the key flow. It takes precedence over the private key that is included in the service account key.

rabbitmqCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the RabbitMQ service

redisCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Redis service

region.description: Region will be used as the default location for regional services. Not all services require a region, some are global
region.deprecationMessage: This attribute is deprecated. Use 'default_region' instead

resourcemanagerCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Resource Manager service

scfCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Cloud Foundry (SCF) service

secretsmanagerCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Secrets Manager service

serverBackupCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Server Backup service

serverUpdateCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Server Update service

serviceAccountCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Service Account service

serviceAccountEmail.description: Service account email. It can also be set using the environment variable STACKIT_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_EMAIL. It is required if you want to use the resource manager project resource. This value is required using OpenID Connect authentication.

serviceAccountFederatedToken.description: The OIDC ID token for use when authenticating as a Service Account using OpenID Connect.

serviceAccountFederatedTokenPath.description: Path for workload identity assertion. It can also be set using the environment variable STACKIT_FEDERATED_TOKEN_FILE.

serviceAccountKey.description: Service account key used for authentication. If set, the key flow will be used to authenticate all operations.

serviceAccountKeyPath.description: Path for the service account key used for authentication. If set, the key flow will be used to authenticate all operations.

serviceAccountToken.description: Token used for authentication. If set, the token flow will be used to authenticate all operations.
serviceAccountToken.deprecationMessage: Authentication via Service Account Token is deprecated and will be removed on December 17, 2025. Please use `service_account_key` or `service_account_key_path` instead. For a smooth transition, refer to our migration guide: https://docs.stackit.cloud/platform/access-and-identity/service-accounts/migrate-flows/

serviceEnablementCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Service Enablement API

sfsCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Stackit Filestorage API

skeCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the Kubernetes Engine (SKE) service

sqlserverflexCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the SQL Server Flex service

tokenCustomEndpoint.description: Custom endpoint for the token API, which is used to request access tokens when using the key flow

useOidc.description: Enables OIDC for Authentication. This can also be sourced from the `STACKIT_USE_OIDC` Environment Variable. Defaults to `false`.

certificate.description: The PEM-encoded TLS certificate. Required for custom certificates.

privateKey.description: The PEM-encoded private key for the certificate. Required for custom certificates. The certificate will be updated if this field is changed.

version.description: A version identifier for the certificate. Required for custom certificates. The certificate will be updated if this field is changed.

backend.description: The configured backend for the distribution

blockedCountries.description: The configured countries where distribution of content is blocked

optimizer.description: Configuration for the Image Optimizer. This is a paid feature that automatically optimizes images to reduce their file size for faster delivery, leading to improved website performance and a better user experience.

regions.description: The configured regions where content will be hosted

bucketUrl.description: The URL of the bucket (e.g. https://s3.example.com). Required if type is 'bucket'.

credentials.description: The credentials for the bucket. Required if type is 'bucket'.

geofencing.description: The configured type http to configure countries where content is allowed. A map of URLs to a list of countries

originRequestHeaders.description: The configured type http origin request headers for the backend

originUrl.description: The configured backend type http for the distribution

region.description: The region where the bucket is hosted. Required if type is 'bucket'.

type.description: The configured backend type. Possible values are: `http`, `bucket`.

accessKeyId.description: The access key for the bucket. Required if type is 'bucket'.

secretAccessKey.description: The access key for the bucket. Required if type is 'bucket'.

type.description: The type of the domain. Each distribution has one domain of type "managed", and domains of type "custom" may be additionally created by the user

algorithm.description: Algorithm for the checksum of the image data.

digest.description: Hexdigest of the checksum of the image data.

rescueBus.description: Sets the device bus when the image is used as a rescue image.

rescueDevice.description: Sets the device when the image is used as a rescue image.

virtioScsi.description: Enables the use of VirtIO SCSI to provide block device access. By default instances use VirtIO Block.

port.description: Port number where we listen for traffic.

protocol.description: Protocol is the highest network protocol we understand to load balance. Possible values are: `PROTOCOL_UNSPECIFIED`, `PROTOCOL_TCP`, `PROTOCOL_UDP`, `PROTOCOL_TCP_PROXY`, `PROTOCOL_TLS_PASSTHROUGH`.

serverNameIndicators.description: A list of domain names to match in order to pass TLS traffic to the target pool in the current listener

targetPool.description: Reference target pool by target pool name.

tcp.description: Options that are specific to the TCP protocol.

udp.description: Options that are specific to the UDP protocol.

name.description: A domain name to match in order to pass TLS traffic to the target pool in the current listener

idleTimeout.description: Time after which an idle connection is closed. The default value is set to 300 seconds, and the maximum value is 3600 seconds. The format is a duration and the unit must be seconds. Example: 30s
Time after which an idle session is closed. The default value is set to 1 minute, and the maximum value is 2 minutes. The format is a duration and the unit must be seconds. Example: 30s

role.description: The role defines how the load balancer is using the network. Possible values are: `ROLE_UNSPECIFIED`, `ROLE_LISTENERS_AND_TARGETS`, `ROLE_LISTENERS`, `ROLE_TARGETS`.

acls.description: Load Balancer is accessible only from an IP address in this range.

observability.description: We offer Load Balancer metrics observability via ARGUS or external solutions. Not changeable after creation.

privateNetworkOnly.description: If true, Load Balancer is accessible only via a private network IP address.

logs.description: Observability logs configuration. Not changeable after creation.

metrics.description: Observability metrics configuration. Not changeable after creation.

credentialsRef.description: Credentials reference for logs. Not changeable after creation.

pushUrl.description: Credentials reference for logs. Not changeable after creation.

credentialsRef.description: Credentials reference for metrics. Not changeable after creation.

pushUrl.description: Credentials reference for metrics. Not changeable after creation.

sessionPersistence.description: Here you can setup various session persistence options, so far only "`use_source_ip_address`" is supported.

targetPort.description: Identical port number where each target listens for traffic.

targets.description: List of all targets which will be used in the pool. Limited to 1000.

healthyThreshold.description: Healthy threshold of the health checking.

interval.description: Interval duration of health checking in seconds.

intervalJitter.description: Interval duration threshold of the health checking in seconds.

timeout.description: Active health checking timeout duration in seconds.

unhealthyThreshold.description: Unhealthy threshold of the health checking.

useSourceIpAddress.description: If true then all connections from one source IP address are redirected to the same target. This setting changes the load balancing algorithm to Maglev.

displayName.description: Target display name

graphite.description: If set, monitoring with Graphite will be enabled. Expects the host and port where the Graphite metrics should be sent to (host:port).

ismDeletionAfter.description: Combination of an integer and a timerange when an index will be considered "old" and can be deleted. Possible values for the timerange are `s`, `m`, `h` and `d`.

javaHeapspace.description: The amount of memory (in MB) allocated as heap by the JVM for OpenSearch.

javaMaxmetaspace.description: The amount of memory (in MB) used by the JVM to store metadata for OpenSearch.

maxDiskThreshold.description: The maximum disk threshold in MB. If the disk usage exceeds this threshold, the instance will be stopped.

metricsFrequency.description: The frequency in seconds at which metrics are emitted (in seconds).

metricsPrefix.description: The prefix for the metrics. Could be useful when using Graphite monitoring to prefix the metrics with a certain value, like an API key.

monitoringInstanceId.description: The ID of the STACKIT monitoring instance.

sgwAcl.description: Comma separated list of IP networks in CIDR notation which are allowed to access this instance.

syslogs.description: List of syslog servers to send logs to.

graphite.description: Graphite server URL (host and port). If set, monitoring with Graphite will be enabled.

maxDiskThreshold.description: The maximum disk threshold in MB. If the disk usage exceeds this threshold, the instance will be stopped.

metricsFrequency.description: The frequency in seconds at which metrics are emitted.

metricsPrefix.description: The prefix for the metrics. Could be useful when using Graphite monitoring to prefix the metrics with a certain value, like an API key

monitoringInstanceId.description: The ID of the STACKIT monitoring instance. Monitoring instances with the plan "Observability-Monitoring-Starter" are not supported.

sgwAcl.description: Comma separated list of IP networks in CIDR notation which are allowed to access this instance.

syslogs.description: List of syslog servers to send logs to.

dailySnapshotRetentionDays.description: The number of days that daily backups will be retained.

monthlySnapshotRetentionMonths.description: The number of months that monthly backups will be retained.

pointInTimeWindowHours.description: The number of hours back in time the point-in-time recovery feature will be able to recover.

snapshotRetentionDays.description: The number of days that continuous backups (controlled via the `backup_schedule`) will be retained.

type.description: Type of the MongoDB Flex instance. Possible values are: `Replica`, `Sharded`, `Single`.

weeklySnapshotRetentionWeeks.description: The number of weeks that weekly backups will be retained.

networkRangeId.deprecationMessage: Deprecated because of the IaaS API v1 -> v2 migration. Will be removed in May 2026. Use the new `stackit.NetworkAreaRegion` resource instead.

prefix.deprecationMessage: Deprecated because of the IaaS API v1 -> v2 migration. Will be removed in May 2026. Use the new `stackit.NetworkAreaRegion` resource instead.

defaultPrefixLength.description: The default prefix length for networks in the network area.

maxPrefixLength.description: The maximal prefix length for networks in the network area.

minPrefixLength.description: The minimal prefix length for networks in the network area.

type.description: CIDRV type. Possible values are: `cidrv4`, `cidrv6`. Only `cidrv4` is supported currently.
Type of the next hop. Possible values are: `blackhole`, `internet`, `ipv4`, `ipv6`. Only `ipv4` supported currently.

value.description: Either IPv4 or IPv6 (not set for blackhole and internet). Only IPv4 supported currently.

alert.description: The name of the alert rule. Is the identifier and must be unique in the group.

annotations.description: A map of key:value. Annotations to add or overwrite for each alert

expression.description: The PromQL expression to evaluate. Every evaluation cycle this is evaluated at the current time, and all resultant time series become pending/firing alerts.

for.description: Alerts are considered firing once they have been returned for this long. Alerts which have not yet fired for long enough are considered pending. Default is 0s

labels.description: A map of key:value. Labels to add or overwrite for each alert

record.description: The name of the metric. It's the identifier and must be unique in the group.

global.description: Global configuration for the alerts. If nothing passed the default argus config will be used. It is only possible to update the entire global part, not individual attributes.

opsgenieApiUrl.description: The host to send OpsGenie API requests to. Must be a valid URL

resolveTimeout.description: The default value used by alertmanager if the alert does not include EndsAt. After this time passes, it can declare the alert as resolved if it has not been updated. This has no impact on alerts from Prometheus, as they always include EndsAt.

smtpAuthIdentity.description: SMTP authentication information. Must be a valid email address

smtpAuthPassword.description: SMTP Auth using LOGIN and PLAIN.

smtpAuthUsername.description: SMTP Auth using CRAM-MD5, LOGIN and PLAIN. If empty, Alertmanager doesn't authenticate to the SMTP server.

smtpFrom.description: The default SMTP From header field. Must be a valid email address

smtpSmartHost.description: The default SMTP smarthost used for sending emails, including port number in format `host:port` (eg. `smtp.example.com:587`). Port number usually is 25, or 587 for SMTP over TLS (sometimes referred to as STARTTLS).

authIdentity.description: SMTP authentication information. Must be a valid email address

from.description: The sender email address. Must be a valid email address

sendResolved.description: Whether to notify about resolved alerts.

smartHost.description: The SMTP host through which emails are sent.

to.description: The email address to send notifications to. Must be a valid email address

apiUrl.description: The host to send OpsGenie API requests to. Must be a valid URL

priority.description: Priority of the alert. Possible values are: `P1`, `P2`, `P3`, `P4`, `P5`.

sendResolved.description: Whether to notify about resolved alerts.

tags.description: Comma separated list of tags attached to the notifications.

googleChat.description: Google Chat webhooks require special handling, set this to true if the webhook is for Google Chat.

msTeams.description: Microsoft Teams webhooks require special handling, set this to true if the webhook is for Microsoft Teams.

sendResolved.description: Whether to notify about resolved alerts.

url.description: The endpoint to send HTTP POST requests to. Must be a valid URL

continue.description: Whether an alert should continue matching subsequent sibling nodes.

groupBies.description: The labels by which incoming alerts are grouped together. For example, multiple alerts coming in for cluster=A and alertname=LatencyHigh would be batched into a single group. To aggregate by all possible labels use the special value '...' as the sole label name, for example: group_by: ['...']. This effectively disables aggregation entirely, passing through all alerts as-is. This is unlikely to be what you want, unless you have a very low alert volume or your upstream notification system performs its own grouping.

groupInterval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification about new alerts that are added to a group of alerts for which an initial notification has already been sent. (Usually ~5m or more.)

groupWait.description: How long to initially wait to send a notification for a group of alerts. Allows to wait for an inhibiting alert to arrive or collect more initial alerts for the same group. (Usually ~0s to few minutes.)

receiver.description: The name of the receiver to route the alerts to.

repeatInterval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification again if it has already been sent successfully for an alert. (Usually ~3h or more).

continue.description: Whether an alert should continue matching subsequent sibling nodes.

To aggregate by all possible labels use the special value '...' as the sole label name, for example: group_by: ['...']. This effectively disables aggregation entirely, passing through all alerts as-is. This is unlikely to be what you want, unless you have a very low alert volume or your upstream notification system performs its own grouping.

groupWait.description: How long to initially wait to send a notification for a group of alerts. Allows to wait for an inhibiting alert to arrive or collect more initial alerts for the same group. (Usually ~0s to few minutes.)

match.description: A set of equality matchers an alert has to fulfill to match the node. This field is deprecated and will be removed after 10th March 2026, use `matchers` in the `routes` instead
match.deprecationMessage: Use `matchers` in the `routes` instead.

matchRegex.description: A set of regex-matchers an alert has to fulfill to match the node. This field is deprecated and will be removed after 10th March 2026, use `matchers` in the `routes` instead
matchRegex.deprecationMessage: Use `matchers` in the `routes` instead.

matchers.description: A list of matchers that an alert has to fulfill to match the node. A matcher is a string with a syntax inspired by PromQL and OpenMetrics.

receiver.description: The name of the receiver to route the alerts to.

repeatInterval.description: How long to wait before sending a notification again if it has already been sent successfully for an alert. (Usually ~3h or more).

expression.description: The LogQL expression to evaluate. Every evaluation cycle this is evaluated at the current time, and all resultant time series become pending/firing alerts.

for.description: Alerts are considered firing once they have been returned for this long. Alerts which have not yet fired for long enough are considered pending. Default is 0s

labels.description: A map of key:value. Labels to add or overwrite for each alert

enableUrlParameters.description: Specifies if URL parameters are enabled. Defaults to `true`

labels.description: Specifies labels.

graphite.description: If set, monitoring with Graphite will be enabled. Expects the host and port where the Graphite metrics should be sent to (host:port).

javaGarbageCollector.description: The garbage collector to use for OpenSearch.

javaHeapspace.description: The amount of memory (in MB) allocated as heap by the JVM for OpenSearch.

javaMaxmetaspace.description: The amount of memory (in MB) used by the JVM to store metadata for OpenSearch.

maxDiskThreshold.description: The maximum disk threshold in MB. If the disk usage exceeds this threshold, the instance will be stopped.

metricsPrefix.description: The prefix for the metrics. Could be useful when using Graphite monitoring to prefix the metrics with a certain value, like an API key.

monitoringInstanceId.description: The ID of the STACKIT monitoring instance.

plugins.description: List of plugins to install. Must be a supported plugin name. The plugins `repository-s3` and `repository-azure` are enabled by default and cannot be disabled.

tlsCiphers.description: List of TLS ciphers to use.

consumerTimeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for the consumer.

lazyfreeLazyEviction.description: The lazy eviction enablement (yes or no).

lazyfreeLazyExpire.description: The lazy expire enablement (yes or no).

maxmemoryPolicy.description: The policy to handle the maximum memory (volatile-lru, noeviction, etc).

type.description: CIDRV type. Possible values are: `cidrv4`, `cidrv6`. Only `cidrv4` is supported during experimental stage.
Type of the next hop. Possible values are: `blackhole`, `internet`, `ipv4`, `ipv6`.

value.description: Either IPv4 or IPv6 (not set for blackhole and internet). Only IPv4 supported during experimental stage.

code.description: ICMP code. Can be set if the protocol is ICMP.

type.description: ICMP type. Can be set if the protocol is ICMP.

max.description: The maximum port number. Should be greater or equal to the minimum.

min.description: The minimum port number. Should be less or equal to the maximum.

name.description: The protocol name which the rule should match. Either `name` or `number` must be provided. Possible values are: `ah`, `dccp`, `egp`, `esp`, `gre`, `icmp`, `igmp`, `ipip`, `ipv6-encap`, `ipv6-frag`, `ipv6-icmp`, `ipv6-nonxt`, `ipv6-opts`, `ipv6-route`, `ospf`, `pgm`, `rsvp`, `sctp`, `tcp`, `udp`, `udplite`, `vrrp`.

number.description: The protocol number which the rule should match. Either `name` or `number` must be provided.

deleteOnTermination.description: Delete the volume during the termination of the server. Only allowed when `source_type` is `image`.

id.description: The ID of the boot volume

performanceClass.description: The performance class of the server.

size.description: The size of the boot volume in GB. Must be provided when `source_type` is `image`.

sourceId.description: The ID of the source, either image ID or volume ID

sourceType.description: The type of the source. Possible values are: `volume`, `image`.

description.description: Description of the Rule

ipAcls.description: IP access control list; IPs must have a subnet mask (e.g. "172.16.0.0/24" for a range of IPs, or "172.16.0.250/32" for a specific IP).

order.description: Order of the rule within a Share Export Policy. The order is used so that when a client IP matches multiple rules, the first rule is applied

readOnly.description: Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule can only mount the share in read only mode

superUser.description: Flag to indicate if client IPs matching this rule have root access on the Share

argus.description: A single argus block as defined below. This field is deprecated and will be removed 06 January 2026.

observability.description: A single observability block as defined below.

allowedCidrs.description: Specify a list of CIDRs to whitelist.

argusInstanceId.description: Argus instance ID to choose which Argus instance is used. Required when enabled is set to `true`.

zones.description: Specify a list of domain filters for externalDNS (e.g., `foo.runs.onstackit.cloud`)

instanceId.description: Observability instance ID to choose which Observability instance is used. Required when enabled is set to `true`.

end.description: End time of hibernation in crontab syntax. E.g. `0 8 * * *` for waking up the cluster at 8am.

start.description: Start time of cluster hibernation in crontab syntax. E.g. `0 18 * * *` for starting everyday at 6pm.

timezone.description: Timezone name corresponding to a file in the IANA Time Zone database. i.e. `Europe/Berlin`.

enableKubernetesVersionUpdates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the Kubernetes version. Defaults to `true`. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [General information for Kubernetes & OS updates](https://docs.stackit.cloud/products/runtime/kubernetes-engine/basics/version-updates/).

enableMachineImageVersionUpdates.description: Flag to enable/disable auto-updates of the OS image version. Defaults to `true`. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [General information for Kubernetes & OS updates](https://docs.stackit.cloud/products/runtime/kubernetes-engine/basics/version-updates/).

end.description: Time for maintenance window end. E.g. `01:23:45Z`, `05:00:00+02:00`.

start.description: Time for maintenance window start. E.g. `01:23:45Z`, `05:00:00+02:00`.

id.description: ID of the STACKIT Network Area (SNA) network into which the cluster will be deployed.

allowSystemComponents.description: Allow system components to run on this node pool.

availabilityZones.description: Specify a list of availability zones. E.g. `eu01-m`

cri.description: Specifies the container runtime. Defaults to `containerd`

labels.description: Labels to add to each node.

maxSurge.description: Maximum number of additional VMs that are created during an update. If set (larger than 0), then it must be at least the amount of zones configured for the nodepool. The `max_surge` and `max_unavailable` fields cannot both be unset at the same time.

maxUnavailable.description: Maximum number of VMs that that can be unavailable during an update. If set (larger than 0), then it must be at least the amount of zones configured for the nodepool. The `max_surge` and `max_unavailable` fields cannot both be unset at the same time.

maximum.description: Maximum number of nodes in the pool.

minimum.description: Minimum number of nodes in the pool.

name.description: Specifies the name of the node pool.

osName.description: The name of the OS image. Defaults to `flatcar`.

osVersion.description: This field is deprecated, use `os_version_min` to configure the version and `os_version_used` to get the currently used version instead.
osVersion.deprecationMessage: Use `os_version_min` to configure the version and `os_version_used` to get the currently used version instead. Setting a specific OS image version will cause errors during minor OS upgrades due to forced updates.

osVersionMin.description: The minimum OS image version. This field will be used to set the minimum OS image version on creation/update of the cluster. If unset, the latest supported OS image version will be used. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [General information for Kubernetes & OS updates](https://docs.stackit.cloud/products/runtime/kubernetes-engine/basics/version-updates/). To get the current OS image version being used for the node pool, use the read-only `os_version_used` field.

osVersionUsed.description: Full OS image version used. For example, if 3815.2 was set in `os_version_min`, this value may result to 3815.2.2. SKE automatically updates the cluster Kubernetes version if you have set `maintenance.enable_kubernetes_version_updates` to true or if there is a mandatory update, as described in [General information for Kubernetes & OS updates](https://docs.stackit.cloud/products/runtime/kubernetes-engine/basics/version-updates/).

taints.description: Specifies a taint list as defined below.

Affinity Group schema.



## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "stackit_affinity_group" "example" {
  project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  name       = "example-affinity-group-name"
  policy     = "hard-anti-affinity"
}

}
```

Folder Role Assignment resource schema.

> This resource is part of the iam experiment and is likely going to undergo significant changes or be removed in the future. Use it at your own discretion.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "stackit_resourcemanager_folder" "example" {
  name        = "example_folder"
  owner_email = "foo.bar@stackit.cloud"
  # in this case a org-id
  parent_container_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
}

resource "stackit_authorization_folder_role_assignment" "fra" {
  resource_id = stackit_resourcemanager_folder.example.folder_id
  role        = "reader"
  subject     = "foo.bar@stackit.cloud"
}

# Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing folder role assignment
import {
  to = stackit_authorization_folder_role_assignment.import-example
  id = "${var.folder_id},${var.folder_role_assignment},${var.folder_role_assignment_subject}"
}
```

role.description: Role to be assigned. Available roles can be queried using stackit-cli: `stackit curl https://authorization.api.stackit.cloud/v2/permissions`

subject.description: Identifier of user, service account or client. Usually email address or name in case of clients

stackit:index/dnsZone:DnsZone.description:
DNS Zone resource schema.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "stackit_dns_zone" "example" {
  project_id    = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  name          = "Example zone"
  dns_name      = "example-zone.com"
  contact_email = "aa@bb.ccc"
  type          = "primary"
  acl           = "192.168.0.0/24"
  description   = "Example description"
  default_ttl   = 1230
}

# Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing dns zone
import {
  to = stackit_dns_zone.import-example
  id = "${var.project_id},${var.zone_id}"
}
```

Edge Cloud is in private Beta and not generally available.
 You can contact support if you are interested in trying it out.

> This resource is in beta and may be subject to breaking changes in the future. Use with caution. See our guide for how to opt-in to use beta resources.

## Example Usage

```terraform
locals {
  project_id   = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  display_name = "edge"
  plan_id      = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  description  = "cats live on the edge"
  region       = "eu01"
}

resource "stackit_edgecloud_instance" "this" {
  project_id   = local.project_id
  display_name = local.display_name
  plan_id      = local.plan_id
  description  = local.description
}

# Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing Edge Cloud instance resource
import {
  to = stackit_edgecloud_instance.this
  id = "${local.project_id},${local.region},INSTANCE_ID"
}
```

Must have a `region` specified in the provider configuration. ## Example Usage ```terraform resource "stackit_image" "example_image" { project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" name = "example-image" disk_format = "qcow2" local_file_path = "./path/to/image.qcow2" min_disk_size = 10 min_ram = 5 } # Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing image # Must set a configuration value for the local_file_path attribute as the provider has marked it as required. # Since this attribute is not fetched in general from the API call, after adding it this would replace your image resource after an pulumi up. # In order to prevent this you need to add: #lifecycle { # ignore_changes = [ local_file_path ] # } import { to = stackit_image.import-example id = "${var.project_id},${var.region},${var.image_id}" } ```

stackit:index/kmsKey:KmsKey.description:
## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "stackit_kms_key" "key" {
  project_id   = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  keyring_id   = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  display_name = "key-01"
  protection   = "software"
  algorithm    = "aes_256_gcm"
  purpose      = "symmetric_encrypt_decrypt"
}
```

accessScope.description: The access scope of the key. Default is `PUBLIC`. Possible values are: `PUBLIC`, `SNA`.

algorithm.description: The encryption algorithm that the key will use to encrypt data. Possible values are: `aes_256_gcm`, `rsa_2048_oaep_sha256`, `rsa_3072_oaep_sha256`, `rsa_4096_oaep_sha256`, `rsa_4096_oaep_sha512`, `hmac_sha256`, `hmac_sha384`, `hmac_sha512`, `ecdsa_p256_sha256`, `ecdsa_p384_sha384`, `ecdsa_p521_sha512`.

description.description: A user chosen description to distinguish multiple keys

displayName.description: The display name to distinguish multiple keys

importOnly.description: States whether versions can be created or only imported.

keyringId.description: The ID of the associated keyring

projectId.description: STACKIT project ID to which the key is associated.

protection.description: The underlying system that is responsible for protecting the key material. Possible values are: `software`.

purpose.description: The purpose for which the key will be used. Possible values are: `symmetric_encrypt_decrypt`, `asymmetric_encrypt_decrypt`, `message_authentication_code`, `asymmetric_sign_verify`.

region.description: The resource region. If not defined, the provider region is used.

stackit:index/kmsWrappingKey:KmsWrapping.description:
KMS wrapping key resource schema.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "stackit_kms_wrapping_key" "example" {
  project_id   = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  keyring_id   = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  display_name = "example-name"
  protection   = "software"
  algorithm    = "rsa_2048_oaep_sha256"
  purpose      = "wrap_symmetric_key"
}
```

disableSecurityGroupAssignment.description: If set to true, this will disable the automatic assignment of a security group to the load balancer's targets. This option is primarily used to allow targets that are not within the load balancer's own network or SNA (STACKIT network area). When this is enabled, you are fully responsible for ensuring network connectivity to the targets, including managing all routing and security group rules manually. This setting cannot be changed after the load balancer is created.

externalAddress.description: External Load Balancer IP address where this Load Balancer is exposed.

listeners.description: List of all listeners which will accept traffic. Limited to 20.

networks.description: List of networks that listeners and targets reside in.

options.description: Defines any optional functionality you want to have enabled on your load balancer.

planId.description: The service plan ID. If not defined, the default service plan is `p10`. Possible values are: `p10`, `p50`, `p250`, `p750`.

privateAddress.description: Transient private Load Balancer IP address. It can change any time.

projectId.description: STACKIT project ID to which the Load Balancer is associated.

region.description: The resource region. If not defined, the provider region is used.

securityGroupId.description: The ID of the egress security group assigned to the Load Balancer's internal machines. This ID is essential for allowing traffic from the Load Balancer to targets in different networks or STACKIT network areas (SNA). To enable this, create a security group rule for your target VMs and set the `remote_security_group_id` of that rule to this value. This is typically used when `disable_security_group_assignment` is set to `true`.

targetPools.description: List of all target pools which will be used in the Load Balancer. Limited to 20.

stackit:index/logsAccessToken:LogsAccess.description: Logs access token resource schema. Uses the `default_region` specified in the provider configuration as a fallback in case no `region` is defined on resource level. ## Example Usage ```terraform resource "stackit_logs_access_token" "accessToken" { project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" instance_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" region = "eu01" display_name = "logs-access-token-example" permissions = [ "read" ] } resource "stackit_logs_access_token" "accessToken2" { project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" instance_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" region = "eu01" display_name = "logs-access-token-example" lifetime = 30 permissions = [ "write" ] description = "Example description" } # Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing logs access token # Note: The generated access token is only available upon creation. # Since this attribute is not fetched from the API call, to prevent the conflicts, you need to add: # lifecycle { # ignore_changes = [ lifetime ] # } import { to = stackit_logs_access_token.import-example id = "${var.project_id},${var.region},${var.logs_instance_id},${var.logs_access_token_id}" } ```

description.description: The description of the access token

displayName.description: The displayed name of the access token

expires.description: Indicates if the access token can expire

instanceId.description: The Logs instance ID associated with the access token

lifetime.description: A lifetime period for an access token in days. If unset the token will not expire.

stackit:index/publicIpAssociate:PublicIp.description: Associates an existing public IP to a network interface. This is useful for situations where you have a pre-allocated public IP or unable to use the `stackit.PublicIp` resource to create a new public IP. Must have a `region` specified in the provider configuration. !> The `stackit.PublicIpAssociate` resource should not be used together with the `stackit.PublicIp` resource for the same public IP or for the same network interface. Using both resources together for the same public IP or network interface WILL lead to conflicts, as they both have control of the public IP and network interface association. ## Example Usage ```terraform resource "stackit_public_ip_associate" "example" { project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" public_ip_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" network_interface_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" } # Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing public ip associate import { to = stackit_public_ip_associate.import-example id = "${var.project_id},${var.region},${var.public_ip_id},${var.network_interface_id}" } ```

stackit:index/resourcemanagerFolder:Reso.description:
Resource Manager folder resource schema.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "stackit_resourcemanager_folder" "example" {
  name                = "example-folder"
  owner_email         = "foo.bar@stackit.cloud"
  parent_container_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
}

# Note:
# You can add projects under folders.
# However, when deleting a project, be aware:
#   - Projects may remain "invisible" for up to 7 days after deletion
#   - During this time, deleting the parent folder may fail because the project is still technically linked
resource "stackit_resourcemanager_project" "example_project" {
  name                = "example-project"
  owner_email         = "foo.bar@stackit.cloud"
  parent_container_id = stackit_resourcemanager_folder.example.container_id
}

# Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing resourcemanager folder
# Note: There will be a conflict which needs to be resolved manually.
# Must set a configuration value for the owner_email attribute as the provider has marked it as required.
import {
  to = stackit_resourcemanager_folder.import-example
  id = var.container_id
}
```

```terraform
resource "stackit_scf_organization_manager" "example" {

  id = "${var.project_id},${var.region},${var.org_id},${var.user_id}"
}
```

Must have a `region` specified in the provider configuration. > When updating `node_pools` of a `stackit.SkeCluster`, the pulumi preview might appear incorrect as it matches the node pools by index rather than by name. However, the SKE API correctly identifies node pools by name and applies the intended changes. Please review your changes carefully to ensure the correct configuration will be applied. ## Example Usage ```terraform resource "stackit_ske_cluster" "example" { project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" name = "example" kubernetes_version_min = "x.x" node_pools = [ { name = "np-example" machine_type = "x.x" os_version = "x.x.x" os_name = "xxx" minimum = "2" maximum = "3" availability_zones = ["eu01-3"] volume_type = "storage_premium_perf6" volume_size = "48" } ] maintenance = { enable_kubernetes_version_updates = true enable_machine_image_version_updates = true start = "01:00:00Z" end = "02:00:00Z" } } # Only use the import statement, if you want to import an existing ske cluster import { to = stackit_ske_cluster.import-example id = "${var.project_id},${var.region},${var.ske_name}" } ```

To get the current kubernetes version being used for your cluster, use the read-only `kubernetes_version_used` field.

Must have a `region` specified in the provider configuration. ## Example Usage ```terraform data "stackit_loadbalancer" "example" { project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx" name = "example-load-balancer" } ```

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getLoadbalancer.

disableSecurityGroupAssignment.description: If set to true, this will disable the automatic assignment of a security group to the load balancer's targets. This option is primarily used to allow targets that are not within the load balancer's own network or SNA (STACKIT Network area). When this is enabled, you are fully responsible for ensuring network connectivity to the targets, including managing all routing and security group rules manually. This setting cannot be changed after the load balancer is created.

externalAddress.description: External Load Balancer IP address where this Load Balancer is exposed.

listeners.description: List of all listeners which will accept traffic. Limited to 20.

networks.description: List of networks that listeners and targets reside in.

options.description: Defines any optional functionality you want to have enabled on your load balancer.

planId.description: The service plan ID. If not defined, the default service plan is `p10`. Possible values are: `p10`, `p50`, `p250`, `p750`.

privateAddress.description: Transient private Load Balancer IP address. It can change any time.

projectId.description: STACKIT project ID to which the Load Balancer is associated.

region.description: The resource region. If not defined, the provider region is used.

securityGroupId.description: The ID of the egress security group assigned to the Load Balancer's internal machines. This ID is essential for allowing traffic from the Load Balancer to targets in different networks or STACKIT Network areas (SNA). To enable this, create a security group rule for your target VMs and set the `remote_security_group_id` of that rule to this value. This is typically used when `disable_security_group_assignment` is set to `true`.

targetPools.description: List of all target pools which will be used in the Load Balancer. Limited to 20.

stackit:index/getPublicIpRanges:getPubli.description:
A list of all public IP ranges that STACKIT uses.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "stackit_public_ip_ranges" "example" {}

# example usage: allow stackit services and customer vpn cidr to access observability apis
locals {
  vpn_cidrs = ["X.X.X.X/32", "X.X.X.X/24"]
}

resource "stackit_observability_instance" "example" {
  project_id = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  name       = "example-instance"
  plan_name  = "Observability-Monitoring-Medium-EU01"
  # Allow all stackit services and customer vpn cidr to access observability apis
  acl                                    = concat(data.stackit_public_ip_ranges.example.cidr_list, local.vpn_cidrs)
  metrics_retention_days                 = 90
  metrics_retention_days_5m_downsampling = 90
  metrics_retention_days_1h_downsampling = 90
}
```

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getPublicIpRanges.

cidrLists.description: A list of IP range strings (CIDRs) extracted from the public*ip*ranges for easy consumption.

publicIpRanges.description: A list of all public IP ranges.

stackit:index/getSkeKubernetesVersions:g.description:
Returns Kubernetes versions as reported by the SKE provider options API for the given region.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "stackit_ske_kubernetes_versions" "example" {
  version_state = "SUPPORTED"
}

resource "stackit_ske_cluster" "example" {
  project_id         = "xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx"
  name               = "example"
  kubernetes_version = data.stackit_ske_kubernetes_versions.example.kubernetes_versions.0.version
  node_pools = [
    {
      name               = "np-example"
      machine_type       = "x.x"
      os_version         = "x.x.x"
      os_name            = "xxx"
      minimum            = "2"
      maximum            = "3"
      availability_zones = ["eu01-1"]
      volume_type        = "storage_premium_perf6"
      volume_size        = "48"
    }
  ]
}
```

region.description: Region override. If omitted, the providers region will be used.

region.description: Region override. If omitted, the providers region will be used.
